How to use Monvvo loan calculator

  1. Enter the total loan amount you want to borrow.
  2. Specify the loan term length, typically 12, 24, 36, 48, or 60 months, based on your repayment timeline.
  3. Provide the anticipated or current interest rate (APR), adjusting if necessary to reflect your actual rate.
  4. If applicable, include any additional fees, such as origination fees, for a more accurate estimate of your loan costs.
  5. Finally, click the calculate button to get an estimate of your monthly payment, total payment, and total interest over the loan term.

Loan Terms

Loan Amount

The loan amount is the total amount of money you borrow from the lender. It represents the principal amount of the loan that you will repay over time, along with interest.

Interest Rate

The interest rate is the percentage charged on the loan amount by the lender. It determines the cost of borrowing money and is factored into your monthly payments.

Loan Term

The loan term is the length of time over which you agree to repay your personal loan. It is typically expressed in months, such as 12, 24, 36, or 60 months.

Origination Fees

Origination fees are the upfront costs charged by the lender to process your loan. These fees, if applicable, are usually deducted from the loan amount.

Extra Payments

Extra payments are additional amounts you can pay toward the loan’s principal. Making extra payments can reduce the total interest paid and shorten the loan term.
